column4: Like much else  Amazon can sell debt in a flash
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Amazon’s aggressive salesmanship now extends to its own debt. The e-commerce giant’s blowout $16 billion bond sale suggests almost unlimited potential for the retailing juggernaut to consider even more shopping. Yet in nearly tripling its financial obligations to buy brick-and-mortar Whole Foods Market  Jeff Bezos’ outfit is starting to look more traditional. The risk is that its stock will too.

column4: Amazon continues heady UK expansion with new distribution centre
column5: LONDON Online retailer Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday it would open a distribution centre in Bristol  south west England  in 2018  continuing a rapid expansion that saw its investments in the UK triple last year to over 400 million pounds ($513.96 million).

column5: Aug 16 UnitedHealth Group Inc  the largest U.S. health insurer  said its president  David Wichmann  would succeed Stephen Hemsley as the company's chief executive  effective Sept. 1.

column4: Wells Fargo changes board  names Duke chair in response to scandal
column5: Wells Fargo & Co  Vice Chair Betsy Duke will replace retiring Chair Stephen Sanger next year  one of several changes announced on Tuesday in a board overhaul following a sales practices scandal.

column4: UPDATE 3-Wells Fargo changes board  names Duke chair in response to scandal
column5: Aug 15 Wells Fargo & Co Vice Chair Betsy Duke will replace retiring Chair Stephen Sanger next year  one of several changes announced on Tuesday in a board overhaul following a sales practices scandal.

column4: Fitch Rates Western Union's Sr. Unsecured Offering 'BBB+'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  August 16 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a 'BBB+' rating to The Western Union Company's $250 million senior unsecured floating rate notes due 2019. The proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes. Fitch currently rates Western Union's $100 million additional 3.6% senior unsecured notes due 2022 'BBB+'. The additional 2022 notes are being issued under the same terms as the $400 million 3.6% senior unsecured notes du
